title: AdS $N$-body problem at large spin
abstract:
Motivated by the problem of multi-twist operators in general CFTs, we study
the leading-twist states of the $N$-body problem in AdS at large spin $J$. We
find that for the majority of states the effective quantum-mechanical problem
becomes semiclassical with $\hbar=1/J$. The classical system at $J=\infty$ has
$N-2$ degrees of freedom, and the classical phase space is identified with the
positive Grassmanian $\mathrm{Gr}_{+}(2,N)$. The quantum problem is recovered
via a Berezin-Toeplitz quantization of a classical Hamiltonian, which we
describe explicitly. For $N=3$ the classical system has one degree of freedom
and a detailed structure of the spectrum can be obtained from Bohr-Sommerfeld
conditions. For all $N$, we show that the lowest excited states are
approximated by a harmonic oscillator and find explicit expressions for their
energies.
